text: Caterina Granz (born 14 March 1994 in Berlin) is a German middle-distance runner who specialises in the 1500 metres. She won gold medal at the 2019 Summer Universiade. ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2012 |World Junior Championships |Barcelona, Spain |16th (h) |1500 m |4:21.25 |- |rowspan=2|2018 |World Cup |London, United Kingdom |4th |1500 m |4:10.04 |- |European Championships |Berlin, Germany |18th (h) |1500 m |4:11.46 |- |rowspan=3|2019 |European Indoor Championships |Birmingham, United Kingdom | – |1500 m |DNF |- |Universiade |Naples, Italy |bgcolor=gold|1st |1500 m |4:09.14 |- |World Championships |Doha, Qatar |31st (h) |1500 m |4:12.36 |} ==Personal bests== Outdoor *800 metres – 2:03.46 (Metz 2019) *1500 metres – 4:07.77 (Lahti 2019) *3000 metres – 9:13.02 (Kiel 2016) *5000 metres – 15:46.64 (Nijmegen 2018) *5 kilometres – 17:02 (Bolzano 2017) *10 kilometres – 34:02 (Berlin 2017) Indoor *800 metres – 2:10.66 (Berlin 2014) *1500 metres – 4:11.38 (Linz 2019) *3000 metres – 8:56.29 (Dortmund 2018) ==References== Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:German female middle- distance runners Category:Sportspeople from Berlin Category:Universiade gold medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Universiade gold medalists for Germany Category:Medalists at the 2019 Summer Universiade
title: Caterina Granz
